Hariz Arthur Maloy, Independent Financial Advisor at Promiseland IndependentTop Contributor (Sep)Level 9. God of WisdomAnswered on 16 Apr 2019Explicit costs, most probably. Even if both platforms use the same underlying instruments, robos would charge lower AUA fees especially for bigger portfolios. However, implicit cost, maybe not. Human advisors can add value by coaching you to stay invested and giving suggestions to top up your investments during a bear market, while robos won't really stop you if you panic and exit your positions.Sometimes the latter can be a bigger reason for your overall portfolio gains.0 comments1
